title: Why is trolling allowed in URF but not Normals?
body: If they are both just for fun game modes why does the punitive system vary between them?

replies.body: The rules are the same for every matchmade game.

I believe what they mean by trolling in this case is that players seem to be allowed to get away with griefing way more, since it seems to be WAY more common. Doing things like leaving a champion in a 2v2 lane to 2v1 so you can go jungle is significantly more common. People are often way more toxic. 

It actually seems like people que up with friends just to have fun, which is good, but for some reason a lot of people think it is fun to flame teammates, and they get away with it way more in this mode.

different wording, same results at the end.

Plus it's an URF game, wave clearing is easy.

When they are doing this because it is fun to watch your teammates struggle, ... and they literally say that in chat, ... Yes, that is definitely trolling. 

And yes, clearing becomes easier for you, but it becomes just as easy for your opponents, and when there are two of them and one of you, .....

> When they are doing this because it is fun to watch your teammates struggle, ... and they literally say that in chat, ... Yes, that is definitely trolling. 

You didn't give that info initially. Don't move the goalposts on people.

Well, it was his post that I initially replied to, so he probably had those details. 

Though his initial post didn't mention all that, so the story is very different when the information is different.

Yeah I think you're confused, my comment was directed at him :)

It is not allowed. All queues have the same rules, anyone saying otherwise is a bullshitter and probably headed for a perm.

First we need to establish what you are defining as a troll.

Are you saying a Poppy building AP is a troll because normally would build tank?

Are you saying someone who jungles instead of duo lane is trolling?

Please be clear.
Nobody really knows what trolling is. Usually "trolling" means different, non-popular ideas. You can troll as much as you want as long as it's not toxic.
Wat? It's not allowed in any game mode.

it doesnt. trolling isnt allowed in ANY gamemode.
but also trolling is way harder to detect and manual reviews are the rarest thing on our planet so yea trolls usually have free roam.
You must have a weird definition of trolling.

Well first off, URF doesn't exist anymore, we do have this thing called ARURF but nobody should take that seriously.


But ya trolling in urf sucks, people will pick terrible champs and be useless all game while the other team always has the best godlike champs so its always onesided, I think that's why ARURF was born.
